Title: Object: The Basso Relievos on the Frieze of the Inner Portico of the Temple of Minerva
Series: Musaeum Graecum et Aegyptiacum
Description: Men and youths on horseback riding right to left, one in the centre standing by a rearing horse, right hand at its neck, left thrown out behind, wearing a cloak flying behind him and a cap; two boys to right, leaning back slightly, the hindmost wearing a broad-brimmed hat; two youths to left, the foremost looking back over his shoulder at his companion, who wears an animal pelt; from stones VII, VIII and IX (left to right and West to East) of the West frieze of the Parthenon. Etching
Curator's comments: Dalton accompanied Lord Charlemont as a draughtsman on his tour of Constantinople, the Levant and Greece in 1749 and on his return to London, published a set of seventy-nine views as the 'Musaeum Graecum et Aegyptiacum' in 1751. Further editions appeared in 1752, 1781 and 1790 and a definitive edition in 1791 and 'Antiquities and views in Freece and Egypt ... with manners and customs of the inhabitants from drawings made on the spot, A.D. 1749'.
